title: Bodybuilder faces life in prison for severely beating his girlfriend
text:
Bodybuilder Paul Bashi, 36, is scheduled to be sentenced in Michigan on Wednesday for the brutal attack on his 23-year-old girlfriend Kristina Perry

A bodybuilder is facing life in prison after pleading no contest to severely beating his girlfriend in a 'roid rage' attack - even though she called for the charges to be dropped.

Paul Bashi, 36, is scheduled to be sentenced in Michigan on Wednesday for the brutal attack on his 23-year-old girlfriend Kristina Perry.

Bashi pleaded no contest last month to attempted murder, torture and illegally possessing steroids in the July 2018 attack that left Perry in a coma.

Authorities say Bashi kicked his girlfriend more than 100 times during the assault in their Detroit-area home.

He also punched her 50 times, stabbed her two dozen times and struck her with a chair.

Graphic surveillance video from inside their home captured Bashi attacking Perry when she walked into the room just moments after he checked her cellphone.

It shows that Bashi threw a number of items at his girlfriend, including candles and protein powder containers.

Bashi's defense attorneys have blamed the attack on his steroid abuse and claimed he flew into a jealous rage.

Perry was found bleeding outside their home by their neighbors.

Bashi was arrested after being found on a nearby street covered in blood.

Despite her horrific injuries, Perry took to the witness stand during Bashi’s arraignment and pleaded for prosecutors to dismiss all charges.

Perry had told the judge the attack was her fault.

Prosecutors said they weren't surprised by the victim's request given their past experience with domestic violence cases.

The investigation into the attack showed that Perry had multiple stab wounds on her body that had been inflicted over a period of time.

Ahead of his sentencing, the judge was taking his no contest plea under advisement. A no-contest plea is not an admission of guilt but is treated as such for sentencing.

Bashi has remained jailed on a $5 million bond since his arrest.
